title: West Ham v Tottenham: Premier League – live
summary: Tottenham is set to begin the post-Daniel Levy era by facing West Ham at the London Stadium. Fans are eager to see if the team can secure a victory in this new chapter. Emillia Hawkins will provide updates on the match.

title: Police say 110,000 attending ‘unite the kingdom’ rally in London, with some in crowd attacking officers – UK politics live
summary: The Metropolitan Police reported that approximately 110,000 people attended a rally, though they found it challenging to confirm exact attendance numbers. Tensions escalated when a group in Whitehall threw projectiles at officers. The situation highlights concerns about safety and public order during large gatherings.

title: Robin Roefs heroics earn Sunderland deserved point at Crystal Palace
summary: In a goalless draw between Sunderland and Crystal Palace, the goalkeeper showcased impressive skills by saving shots from Yeremy Pino, Christantus Uche, and Jean-Philippe Mateta. The match highlighted the goalkeeper's key role in maintaining a clean sheet. Despite several scoring opportunities, neither team managed to find the back of the net.

title: Emiliano Martínez denies Everton and Grealish to secure a point for Aston Villa
summary: Everton and Aston Villa played to a 0-0 draw, marking Villa's third consecutive match without a goal this season. The result highlights Villa's ongoing struggles to find the back of the net. Both teams will be looking to improve their attacking performances in upcoming matches.

title: Nick Woltemade makes instant impact on Newcastle debut to see off Wolves
summary: Nick Woltemade made a successful debut for Newcastle after joining the team on deadline day. He scored the only goal in a 1-0 victory against Wolves. This win marked a positive start for the new signing.
